psychometRics 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Discrimination correlation

    discrimination_cor.Rd

    The function provide correlation item rest (rir) or correlation item test (rit) for a all of the item in the test. Multiple type of item corrleation are provided as somer's d, point biserial correlation and polyserial correlation for non dichotomic item Result could be interpretend as the item ability to discriminate between a lower and higher difficulty for this item in regard to the overall raw score.

    Usage

    discrimination_cor(
  data,
  items,
  type = "rir",
  method = c("cor", "somer", "polyserial"),
  conf.level = 0.95,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    a data.frame containing the test or scale response in columns

    items

    The name of the items (should be >1 )

    type

    type correlation could be rir for Rest Item-correlation or rit for Total Item-correlation (can be both)

    method

    the type of correlation to use c("cor","somer","polyserial")

    conf.level

    the confidence interval for the correlation needed

    Value

    a data.frame with the result and confidence interval

    Examples

    data("inference")
items <- c(paste0("item_0",3:9),"item_10")
discrimination_cor(inference, items)
#>   type    item         r  r.lwr.ci  r.upr.ci  somers.d somers.lwr.ci
#> 1  rir item_03 0.4450732 0.4116532 0.4772977 0.5659784     0.5015010
#> 2  rir item_04 0.4125828 0.3780483 0.4459706 0.5635974     0.4818141
#> 3  rir item_05 0.4896669 0.4579252 0.5201617 0.5878897     0.5347608
#> 4  rir item_06 0.5634606 0.5348756 0.5907573 0.6841167     0.6327604
#> 5  rir item_07 0.4893683 0.4576148 0.5198752 0.5601048     0.5226987
#> 6  rir item_08 0.2912004 0.2533020 0.3282064 0.3143698     0.2683658
#> 7  rir item_09 0.4171450 0.3827616 0.4503745 0.4723415     0.4327335
#> 8  rir item_10 0.3927835 0.3576144 0.4268401 0.4971675     0.4517085
#>   somers.upr.ci polyserial
#> 1     0.6304557  0.6148742
#> 2     0.6453806  0.6000359
#> 3     0.6410186  0.6502255
#> 4     0.7354729  0.7462634
#> 5     0.5975109  0.6146025
#> 6     0.3603738  0.3688786
#> 7     0.5119494  0.5228201
